title: Robert Byrne - Blame it on the night - 1979 - West Coast pop roc
description:
A wonderful album by a man who left us much too soon. Known far and wide as one to the top songwriters, it is amazing to hear what a great singer he was. Kind of a cross between Kenny Loggins and James Taylor only with a voice that conveyed the emotion of a song better than either Loggins or Taylor. 

This album features a list of some of Muscle Shoals finest: Clayton Ivey on keyboards, Roger Clark on drums, Bob Wray&#039;s funky bass, former Steppenwolf guitarist Larry Byrom, Jimmy Buffett&#039;s right-hand man,Mac MacAnally and Terry Woodford&#039;s superb engineering. 

Enjoy, please comment and seed
